result.name: british-virgin-islands-video-survey-centre-points
result.notes:
A video survey was undertaken between the 12th and 20th August 2014 as part of 
the Darwin Plus funded project (DPLUS026) in the British Virgin Islands. The 
survey collected video and still imagery at 64 locations across the area which 
had previously been surveyed using a multibeam echosounder. The imagery 
consists of imagery from the seabed to determine the physical characteristics 
and biological communities. Each station was comprised of two 5 minute tows, 
with acquisition of continuous video data and still images approximately every 
15 seconds. Still images were collected using a Nikon D200 with a fish-eye 
lens. This dataset is a summary dataset showing the centre point for all 
stations. GPS data was collected by Cefas using portable GPS unit connected to 
ArcGIS. Images are available in *.jpg format, video data in digital movie 
format.

organization.name: marine-environmental-data-information-network
